sub_title: Lecturer at Rotterdam School of Management, Erasmus University
summary:
Presently Taslim is a lecturer and coordinator in the Professional Development course and I DO course, at Rotterdam School of Management (RSM), Erasmus University Rotterdam, the Netherlands.
As core expertise, Taslim is a GIS Analyst and Data Scientist with thirteen years of work experience.
His core competencies are GIS analysis; Satellite Image Processing; Data collection, preprocessing, integration, and analysis; Research; Lecturing; Master's thesis supervision; and Article writing. 
Another area of valuable experience that Taslim specializes in is large Infrastructure adoption within the Urban Management and Smart City Development domains, with eight years of work experience.
Taslim’s additional valuable experience is in project management as a trained project manager by The United Nations International Charter, Space, and Major Disasters.

awards.title: International Astronautics Federation (IAF)  Young Professional Awards
awards.description:
I was one of the ten students and young professionals selected from over 70 well-qualified applicants in 31 countries. We also participated in the activities of the IAC Student Programme organized by the International Space Education Board and the IAF Young Professional Programme which were conducted during the Congress at Prague, Czech Republic. We met with IAF-assigned mentors and student/young professional advisors were given special recognition during the Congress.
In addition, we had the opportunity to participate in the Space Generation Congress and the 2010 UN/IAF Workshop held just before the Congress. Following the Congress, the grant recipients reported on the activities they undertook upon their return home to build on the experiences they gained during the Congress and to share what they have learned. Scientific papers were also presented during the congress.

projects.title: SUSTAINABILITY BENEFITS ASSESSMENT (SBA) FOR GREEN GROWTH PROJECTS IN URBAN AREAS
projects.description:
I played the role of a GIS and Sustainability Assessment expert on the project - SUSTAINABILITY BENEFITS ASSESSMENT (SBA). A HANDBOOK FOR GREEN GROWTH PROJECTS IN URBAN AREAS, DONE BY IHS-ERASMUS UNIVERSITY TEAM FOR THE WORLD BANK
A. Define the appropriate framework to differentiate the changes (impacts) in time due to the project implementation.
B. Provide clear definitions of primary, secondary, tertiary benefits and/or physical, stock, welfare, etc.
C. How these definitions relate to environmental, social and economic benefits?  How does this definition relate to sustainability? 
D. How are the different urban agendas integrated into the overall SBs framework (in the form of benefits/indicators)? Integrate resilience and green growth principles in the framework, relating them with these urban agendas. Integrating Urban Agendas in overall SBs Framework.
E. Map based approach: Define what is the use of the maps in the methodology (identification of benefits, measurement of benefits, the illustration of benefits, distribution of benefits, communication)? Exploring the use of GIS maps while displaying results in the Matrix providing detailed comments. GIS maps methodology for benefits.
F. Restructuring primary vs. secondary sustainability benefits, to suit recent demands from the World Bank project beneficiary countries

From 2018 to date, I teach urban transport governance as applied to cities in the transition to urban public transport, such as light-rail and Bus Rapid Transit (BRT). 
The participants learn how multi-actors within the government, private sectors, and the public interact within different governance structures, to provide required transport infrastructure to the people. 
In addition, they learn how to manage these transport infrastructures in a sustainable manner, using sustainability indicators, to overcome different contextual challenges, ranging from inadequate finance, third party issues, overlapping authority functions, and negative travel behavior of passengers.

volunteer_experiences.role: Project Manager for International Charter, Space and Major Disasters
volunteer_experiences.description:
Certified Project Manager (PM) for the North-East (Adamawa/Taraba states) Nigeria Flood disaster in 2012, by The United Nations International Charter, Space and Major Disasters.
 As a PM, I worked with a team, consisting of other stakeholders such as the National Emergency Management Agency (NEMA) and Adamawa/Taraba states/local government institutions. 
The UN charter was officially named Charter Activation- 344, Charter Call ID- 407, date of final reporting- 1 October 2012. 
A release of excess water from the Ladgo dam in Cameroun, which led to the flooding of the river Benue corridor into the Adamawa and Taraba States, which, were the closest states to the Cameroun border. Continuous heavy rains also added devastating effects to the flood. This led to the loss of lives and properties, making many homeless.
The quality of the value-added products is good for better and timely decision making on disaster response and management. 
The spatial products generated supported the end users - National Emergency Management Agency (NEMA) in the following ways: 
1. Relocate few of the Internally Displaced Persons (IDP) camps from areas still liable to flood to upland not liable to flood. This was done by overlaying a topographic layer on the 2.5m pan-sharpened SPOT image.
2. Assess the area coverage of the flood and inform the other people staying at the floodplains to relocate to provided areas.
3. Approximate the buildings in the settlements affected in order to quantify the level of damage and compensation for the affected persons. This also helped in approximating the population and relief materials to be distributed in such affected areas.
4. Analysis of areas affected provided adequate data for the recovery process phase of the disaster. It also provided local institutions in Adamawa/Taraba States with ideas on the kinds of scenarios to expect, prepare and respond to such flood disaster in the future., through their experience with the team during the process.
